results.title: A Crutch for all seasons
results.creator_credit: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and Burt Martin Associates
results.brief_description: An examination of the personal dependencies of three young people - for Frank the crutch was liquor, for Billy it was pot, for Max it was hard stuff. Each becomes involved in tragedy and each, at the brink, turns back from his false dependency.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and Burt Martin Associates

results.title: Cross country runner
results.creator_credit: Mark McCarty and Department of Theatre Arts, University of California
results.brief_description: A light-hearted allegorical spoof of modern society, depicting the trials and tribulations of a cross-country runner who takes time out from a race to visit friends and family. Cast includes David Aldrich.

results.title: Critical path
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Uses the construction of a service station to illustrate the critical path method of planning and scheduling, in which a project is broken down into distinct operations, the time for completion of each estimated, and the longest irreduceable sequence of operations calculated. Consecutive and concurrent operations are identified and the most efficient use of working time planned.

results.title: Cricket batting strokes. Part 1
results.brief_description: Made to show students the fundamentals of good batsmanship, with demonstrations by Len Hutton and coaching by H. P. Craptree. The film falls into three sections. Part one “Forward Defence and Attack”: The forward defence stroke is analysed; the stance, grip of bat and method of making the stroke are illustrated in shorts of Hutton practising at the nets. The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed.

The forward attack stroke is similarly analysed.

results.title: The Creative person: Tyrone Guthrie
results.creator_credit: Joyce Chopra and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A profile of Tyrone Guthrie the eminent theatrical director, showing him in several locales while he works, lectures and relaxes. In interviews he discusses his general philosophy towards the theatre as a medium. June Havoc and Darren McGavin describe the feelings which most actors have towards working with Guthrie.

results.title: Cornering and overtaking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates by high angle photography, graphics and animation how certain forces are set in motion when we change direction in a car. Safe methods of cornering, positioning and overtaking are shown, and points of courtesy and common sense in each case are noted.

results.title: Cormorant fishing
results.brief_description: Introducing cormorant fishing, a very old and unusual method of fishing using the cormorant bird. This has become an annual event - a festival on the Nagara River at Gifu near Nagoya, attracting visitors from all over the world.
results.description: Introducing cormorant fishing, a very old and unusual method of fishing using the cormorant bird. This has become an annual event - a festival on the Nagara River at Gifu near Nagoya, attracting visitors from all over the world.

results.title: Copenhagen holiday
results.brief_description: A film whose feature is the Bing and Grohdahl Porcelain Potteries in Copenhagen. Shows the beautiful ceramic figures being made and hand-painted. The sung narration adds an unusual slant to the film.

results.title: A Conversation with Frank Lloyd Wright
results.brief_description: One of the world’s most original and influential architects discusses his theories of functional architecture and analyses contemporary styles. In a conversation covering a broad range of topics, Mr Wright displays the agile wit and eloquence that have made him one of the most colourful personalities of our time.

results.title: Concrete pays
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Drayton Film Productions
results.brief_description: The use of concrete can help farmers achieve greater efficiency, safety and hygiene. Deals with its use on farms for roads, yards and block-walling, insulated floors and the correct methods to be used in such work by inexperienced farm labour. Uses of cement based paints are also shown.
